definition[0]: the act of putting a new feeling or quality into something
example[0]: Further education badly needs the infusion of more resources.
definition[1]: the act of putting medicine slowly into someoneâ€™s body, or the medicine itself
definition[2]: a drink made with herbs in hot water that is usually taken as a medicine
definition[3]: the act of putting a lot of money or something else that is needed into a company, organization etc
example[2]: Most Japanese acquisitions have been followed by an infusion of capital or technology.
example[3]: Despite a $65 billion government cash infusion, the big banks are not expected to turn decent profits for several years.
